docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Tuesday Reading: The Changing Insurance Appeals Process

docs.abstract: How the new health law makes the appeals process more consumer-friendly, where the highest cigarette taxes are and other consumer-focused items from Tuesday's Times.
docs.snippet: How the new health law makes the appeals process more consumer-friendly, where the highest cigarette taxes are and other consumer-focused items from Tuesday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is set to allow gay workers to take medical leave to care for the sick or newborn children of their same-sex partners.

headline.main: The Early Word: Gay Rights Expansion

docs.abstract: President Obama is set to expand rights included in the Family and Medical Leave Act to gays and lesbians.
docs.snippet: President Obama is set to expand rights included in the Family and Medical Leave Act to gays and lesbians.

headline.main: Will My Premiums Rise Because of the New Law?

docs.abstract: Premiums in large self-funded plans probably will not increase, and may decline, under the new health care law, according to the Congressional Budget Office.
docs.snippet: Premiums in large self-funded plans probably will not increase, and may decline, under the new health care law, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Kamber was covering the war in Liberia in 2003. He had a Hasselblad. A stranger pointed out that another photographer - this one accompanying the rebels - also had a Hasselblad. "I was sure he was mistaken," Mr. Kamber recalled. "Two photographers stupid - or impractical - enough to photograph the war in medium format? Impossible. But the stranger turned out to be correct. The other photographer was Tim Hetherington.  We met later on, covered the civil war in the Ivory Coast together and have been friends ever since."
docs.abstract: With the premier nearing of his documentary, "Restrepo," Tim Hetherington takes time to talk with Michael Kamber about the future of photojournalism.
docs.snippet: With the premier nearing of his documentary, "Restrepo," Tim Hetherington takes time to talk with Michael Kamber about the future of photojournalism.

docs.lead_paragraph:
The president plans to warn
executives on Tuesday against raising rates steeply in anticipation of tighter regulations under the new health care law.
